headline: Is S&P Global (SPGI) Still Priced Fairly After The Recent Share Price Slump
summary: If you are wondering whether S&P Global's share price still lines up with its underlying worth, this article will walk you through what the current numbers are actually saying. The stock last closed at US$397.20, after a 12.1% decline over the past week, a 26.7% decline over the past month, a 22.5% decline year to date, a 26.2% decline over the past year, and longer term returns of 13.8% over three years and 22.3% over five years. Recent coverage has focused on how the company fits into the...

headline: How Recent Analyst Shifts Are Rewriting The Story For S&P Global (SPGI)
summary: The updated fair value estimate for S&P Global has shifted to US$610.50 from US$504.91, while the model now uses a higher discount rate of 8.08% instead of 7.02% and slightly adjusts revenue growth expectations from 7.28% to 7.20%. This reflects how recent Street research is balancing solid Q4 issuance trends and long term earnings potential against more cautious views on risk and growth assumptions, which sit behind both higher and lower analyst targets around the US$611 level. As you read...

headline: New territory: RXO debt rating from Moody’s now below investment-grade cutoff
summary: RXO has seen its debt rating cut by Moody’s to a non-investment grade level. The post New territory: RXO debt rating from Moody’s now below investment-grade cutoff appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: S&P Global Ratings Wins Ratings Provider of the Year at Private Equity Wire European Awards
summary: S&P Global Ratings was named Ratings Provider of the Year at the 2026 Private Equity Wire European Awards ceremony, held on Thursday, 12 February at County Hall, London. The award recognises S&P Global Ratings' role in enhancing transparency and enabling decision-making across European private markets.

headline: MSCI: 13.9% Dividend Hike And Double-Digit Growth
summary: MSCI posted 93.4% retention and a robust 62.2% adjusted EBITDA margin in Q4 2025. Read why MSCI stock offers a compelling investment case.

headline: 2 Large-Cap Stocks with Promising Prospects and 1 That Underwhelm
summary: Large-cap stocks usually command their industries because they have the scale to drive market trends. The flip side though is that their sheer size can limit growth as expanding further becomes an increasingly challenging task.

raw.headline: 2 Large-Cap Stocks with Promising Prospects and 1 That Underwhelm

headline: S&P Global Rally Story Tested By 2025 Strength And Mobility Spin Off
summary: S&P Global reported strong 2025 results with revenue growth, margin expansion, dividend increases, and substantial share repurchases. The company announced new initiatives in artificial intelligence and private markets during 2025. S&P Global confirmed plans to spin off its Mobility business as Mobility Global, with key developments expected next quarter. S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI) is pairing these business updates with a share price of $397.2. That comes after a 12.1% decline over the past 7...
